column4: hi, can someone help me? when i start gnome and the network is on the panels crash... when i start with the network off (ifdown ra0) it loads ok
check the panel applets. one may rely on net connectivity (e.g. weather)
i tried removing all the applets - can there be "invisible" applets?
try moving .gconf aside and see wha'ppens.
is .gconf - what holds all the definitions for the panels?
.gconf = GNOME configuration settings.
lots of stuff in there, not just apnel applets. but if by moving it aside the problem disappears, you have a better idea of the culprit.
- just got an error window from gnome: "there was an error starting the GNOME setting deamon"... is it giving us any clues?
nope, that's expected. .gconf has gone "missing" but GNOME *should* load anyway.
it will complain, but still start. or should.
system exception: IDL:Bonobo/
I didn't remove .gconf yet
ok, will do.
what about .gconfd?
try with that in place, and if it fails, set that aside, too.
are you still here?
eye yam
- brb...
(sorry for the delay) i removed .gconf and .gconfd

the situation no is as follows: if i login gnome with networking it takes about ~3-5 minutes to login (from the greeter to the desktop) most of the time i see the brown screen. after which gnome starts ok (so it seems)
if i start gnome without networking it starts just fine
(no more than 20 secs.)
